com.android.ex.carousel

Class CarouselView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • android.renderscript.RSSurfaceView
          • com.android.ex.carousel.CarouselView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyCarouselView

    public abstract class CarouselView
extends android.renderscript.RSSurfaceView

    This class represents the basic building block for using a 3D Carousel. The Carousel is basically a scene of cards and slots. The spacing between cards is dictated by the number of slots and the radius. The number of visible cards dictates how far the Carousel can be moved. If the number of cards exceeds the number of slots, then the Carousel will continue to go around until the last card can be seen.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder,
                           int format,
                           int w,
                           int h)
        Description copied from interface: android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        This is called immediately after any structural changes (format or size) have been made to the surface. You should at this point update the imagery in the surface. This method is always called at least once, after SurfaceHolder.Callback.surfaceCreated(android.view.SurfaceHolder).
        Specified by:
        surfaceChanged in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Overrides:
        surfaceChanged in class android.renderscript.RSSurfaceView
        Parameters:
        holder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface has changed.
        format - The new PixelFormat of the surface.
        w - The new width of the surface.
        h - The new height of the surface.

      • interpretLongPressEvents

        public boolean interpretLongPressEvents()
        Do I want to interpret the long-press gesture? If so, long-presses will cancel the current selection and call the appropriate callbacks. Otherwise, a long press will not be handled any way other than as a continued drag.
        Returns:
        True if we interpret long-presses

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the loaded mesh or null if it cannot be loaded

      • setSlotCount

        public void setSlotCount(int n)
        Set the number of slots around the Carousel. Basically equivalent to the poles horses might attach to on a real Carousel.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of slots

      • setVisibleSlots

        public void setVisibleSlots(int n)
        Sets the number of visible slots around the Carousel. This is primarily used as a cheap form of clipping. The Carousel will never show more than this many cards.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of visible slots

      • setPrefetchCardCount

        public void setPrefetchCardCount(int n)
        Set the number of cards to pre-load that are outside of the visible region, as determined by setVisibleSlots(). This number gets added to the number of visible slots and used to determine when resources for cards should be loaded. This number should be small (n <= 4) for systems with limited texture memory or views that show more than half dozen cards in the view.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards; should be even, so the count is the same on each side

      • setRowCount

        public void setRowCount(int n)
        Sets the number of rows of cards to show in each slot.

      • setRowSpacing

        public void setRowSpacing(float s)
        Sets the spacing between each row of cards when rowCount > 1.

      • setFirstCardTop

        public void setFirstCardTop(boolean f)
        Sets the position of the first card when rowCount > 1.

      • setOverscrollSlots

        public void setOverscrollSlots(float slots)
        Sets the amount of allowed overscroll (in slots)

      • setVisibleDetails

        public void setVisibleDetails(int n)
        Set the number of detail textures that can be visible at one time.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of slots

      • setDetailTextureAlignment

        public void setDetailTextureAlignment(int alignment)
        Sets how detail textures are aligned with respect to the card.
        Parameters:
        alignment - a bitmask of DetailAlignment flags.

      • setForceBlendCardsWithZ

        public void setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean enabled)
        Set whether depth is enabled while blending. Generally, this is discouraged because it causes bad artifacts. Careful attention to geometry and alpha transparency of textures can mitigate much of this. For example, geometry for an item must be drawn back-to-front if any edges overlap.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable depth while blending, and false to disable it.

      • setDrawRuler

        public void setDrawRuler(boolean drawRuler)
        Set whether to draw a ruler from the card to the detail texture
        Parameters:
        drawRuler - True to draw a ruler, false to draw nothing where the ruler would go.

      • createCards

        public void createCards(int n)
        This dictates how many cards are in the deck. If the number of cards is greater than the number of slots, then the Carousel goes around n / slot_count times. Can be called again to increase or decrease the number of cards.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards to create.

      • getCardCount

        public int getCardCount()

      • setTextureForItem

        public void setTextureForItem(int n,
                              android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This sets the texture on card n. It should only be called in response to CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int). Since there's no guarantee that a given texture is still on the screen, replacing this texture should be done by first setting it to null and then waiting for the next CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int) to swap it with the new one.
        Parameters:
        n - the card given by CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int)
        bitmap - the bitmap image to show

      • setDetailTextureForItem

        public void setDetailTextureForItem(int n,
                                    float offx,
                                    float offy,
                                    float loffx,
                                    float loffy,
                                    android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This sets the detail texture that floats above card n. It should only be called in response to CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestDetailTexture(int). Since there's no guarantee that a given texture is still on the screen, replacing this texture should be done by first setting it to null and then waiting for the next CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestDetailTexture(int) to swap it with the new one.
        Parameters:
        n - the card to set detail texture for
        offx - an optional offset to apply to the texture (in pixels) from top of detail line
        offy - an optional offset to apply to the texture (in pixels) from top of detail line
        loffx - an optional offset to apply to the line (in pixels) from left edge of card
        loffy - an optional offset to apply to the line (in pixels) from top of screen
        bitmap - the bitmap to show as the detail

      • setDefaultBitmap

        public void setDefaultBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the bitmap to show on a card when the card draws the very first time. Generally, this bitmap will only be seen during the first few frames of startup or when the number of cards are changed. It can be ignored in most cases, as the cards will generally only be in the loading or loaded state.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setLoadingBitmap

        public void setLoadingBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Sets the bitmap to show on the card while the texture is loading. It is set to this value just before CarouselRS.CarouselCallback.onRequestTexture(int) is called and changed when setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap) is called. It is shared by all cards.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float red,
                               float green,
                               float blue,
                               float alpha)
        Sets background to specified color. If a background texture is specified with setBackgroundBitmap(Bitmap), then this call has no effect.
        Parameters:
        red - the amount of red
        green - the amount of green
        blue - the amount of blue
        alpha - the amount of alpha

      • setBackgroundBitmap

        public void setBackgroundBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Can be used to optionally set the background to a bitmap. When set to something other than null, this overrides CarouselView#setBackgroundColor(Float4).
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDetailLoadingBitmap

        public void setDetailLoadingBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Can be used to optionally set a "loading" detail bitmap. Typically, this is just a black texture with alpha = 0 to allow details to slowly fade in.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDetailLineBitmap

        public void setDetailLineBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This texture is used to draw a line from the card alongside the texture detail. The line will be as wide as the texture. It can be used to give the line glow effects as well as allowing other blending effects. It is typically one dimensional, e.g. 3x1.
        Parameters:
        bitmap -

      • setDefaultGeometry

        public void setDefaultGeometry(int resId)
        This geometry will be shown when no geometry has been loaded for a given slot. If not set, a quad will be drawn in its place. It is shared for all cards. If something other than simple planar geometry is used, consider enabling depth test with setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean)
        Parameters:
        resId -

      • setDefaultCardMatrix

        public void setDefaultCardMatrix(float[] matrix)
        Sets the matrix used to transform card geometries. By default, this is the identity matrix, but you can specify a different matrix if you want to scale, translate and / or rotate the card before drawing.
        Parameters:
        matrix - array of 9 or 16 floats representing a 3x3 or 4x4 matrix, or null as a shortcut for an identity matrix.

      • setLoadingGeometry

        public void setLoadingGeometry(int resId)
        This is an intermediate version of the object to show while geometry is loading. If not set, a quad will be drawn in its place. It is shared for all cards. If something other than simple planar geometry is used, consider enabling depth test with setForceBlendCardsWithZ(boolean)
        Parameters:
        resId -

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(CarouselRS.CarouselCallback callback)
        Sets the callback for receiving events from RenderScript.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle(float angle)
        Sets the startAngle for the Carousel. The start angle is the first position of the first slot draw. Cards will be drawn from this angle in a counter-clockwise manner around the Carousel.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle, in radians.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(float radius)

      • setCardRotation

        public void setCardRotation(float cardRotation)

      • setCardsFaceTangent

      • setFrictionCoefficient

      • setDragModel

        public void setDragModel(int model)

      • setLookAt

        public void setLookAt(float[] eye,
                      float[] at,
                      float[] up)

      • setRezInCardCount

        public void setRezInCardCount(float n)
        This sets the number of cards in the distance that will be shown "rezzing in". These alpha values will be faded in from the background to the foreground over 'n' cards. A floating point value is used to allow subtly changing the rezzing in position.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of cards to rez in.

      • setFadeInDuration

        public void setFadeInDuration(long t)
        This sets the duration (in ms) that a card takes to fade in when loaded via a call to setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap). The timer starts the moment setTextureForItem(int, Bitmap) is called and continues until all of the cards have faded in. Note: using large values will extend the animation until all cards have faded in.
        Parameters:
        t -

      • onDetachedFromWindow

        protected void onDetachedFromWindow()
        Description copied from class: android.view.View
        This is called when the view is detached from a window. At this point it no longer has a surface for drawing.
        Overrides:
        onDetachedFromWindow in class android.view.SurfaceView
        See Also:
        View.onAttachedToWindow()

      • onAttachedToWindow

        protected void onAttachedToWindow()
        Description copied from class: android.view.View
        This is called when the view is attached to a window. At this point it has a Surface and will start drawing. Note that this function is guaranteed to be called before View.onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas), however it may be called any time before the first onDraw -- including before or after View.onMeasure(int, int).
        Overrides:
        onAttachedToWindow in class android.view.SurfaceView
        See Also:
        View.onDetachedFromWindow()
